intro: Mitracarpus hasslerianus, commonly known as the Mexican coffee plant, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces distinctive, spiny fruits that contain seeds used in traditional medicine. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some regions for both horticultural and pharmacological purposes.
